title: Moving Money on a Tech-Free Day
vignette: Alex notices cash left on the windowsill just minutes before a family's screen-free, no-work rest day begins. Leaving it risks theft from the street below.

options.text: Leave the money despite the risk, adhering to the no-work rule.
Move the coins to a safe place discreetly.

title: Forgot the Rest-Day Candles
vignette: A family observing a total work-halt realizes after sunset that their dinner table is dark. Their non-observant housekeeper offers to light candles.

options.text: Allow the housekeeper to light them.
Decline; benefiting from such work is against the rules.

title: Visiting the sick carrying medicine
vignette: Lena wishes to bring medicine to her ill friend on the rest day. Carrying items outside is normally prohibited, but the friend may suffer without it.

options.text: Carry the medicine to alleviate suffering.
Refrain from carrying; wait until the rest day ends.

title: Kitchen Fire on No-Work Day
vignette: A small blaze ignites in the kitchen during the unplugged rest day and could spread to neighbors.

options.text: Let it burn unless lives are in immediate danger.
Extinguish it quickly to protect everyone.

title: Dangerous Insect Near Children
vignette: A venomous scorpion heads toward sleeping kids during the no-work period; the family's principles prohibit killing creatures.

options.text: Kill it to remove the threat.
Trap it without killing and release it later.

title: Wearing loose jewelry outside
vignette: Robin wants to wear a new pin to a community center event, but it might slip off, and she would then be carrying it, which is against the day's rules.

options.text: Wear it and be careful not to drop it.
Avoid wearing it to prevent accidentally breaking the rules.

title: Bathing in hot water prepared before rest day
vignette: Water was heated legally before the rest day. May the family take warm baths on the rest day afternoon?

options.text: Bathe and enjoy the prepared comfort.
Refrain, as others might suspect it was heated today, undermining the community's commitment.

title: Timing a Cultural Rite
vignette: Day 8 of a newborn's cultural rite falls on the family's work-free day, but the baby has a mild fever.

options.text: Delay the rite until the infant is well.
Perform it now to fulfill the cultural obligation on time.

title: Messenger Offers to Carry Package
vignette: A courier who doesn't follow the rest-day practice arrives, willing to hand-carry a bottle of wine across town.

options.text: Allow him to carry it on his own initiative.
Refuse, as it appears as if he is acting on your behalf, which is against the spirit of the day.

title: Saving Books from a Fire
vignette: A small library fire threatens rare manuscripts during the no-work day. Carrying items outdoors is normally restricted.

options.text: Rescue them; their cultural value warrants it.
Leave them; carrying them into a public domain is forbidden by the day's rules.

title: Cow in a Ditch on Rest Day
vignette: A farm animal falls into a shallow pit; rescuing it requires building a ramp, which is considered 'work.'

options.text: Build the ramp and free the animal to prevent suffering.
Wait until after the rest day, even if the animal suffers.

title: Using medicine for minor pain
vignette: Rachel has a throbbing headache on the rest day. Taking medicine is generally restricted when not life-threatening.

options.text: Take the pill for relief.
Endure the pain until the rest day ends.

title: Clapping and dancing at a celebration
vignette: Guests at a rest day wedding want to clap and dance joyfully, though some experts have banned it lest it lead to fixing musical instruments.

options.text: Join the dancing and rejoice with the couple.
Refrain from rhythmic clapping and dancing to uphold the rules.

title: Labor Begins on Rest Day
vignette: A woman goes into labor; full medical care will require activities normally banned on the technology-free day.

options.text: Do everything necessary, even if it violates the rest day rules.
Minimize work and do only what is absolutely required, respecting the day's principles.

title: Moving a heavy object blocking a doorway
vignette: A large barrel rolled in front of the house entrance on the rest day. Moving it may involve exertion that is normally avoided.

options.text: Shift it aside to allow people in and out.
Leave it until the rest day ends.
